definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Beads shall be fitted at the factory and delivered attached to frames.
sentences.chinese: 珠子應當在工廠安裝，裝上框子後發運。

sentences.english: for our clients need the items urgently. we hope that you deliver it asap.
sentences.chinese: 由於我方客戶急需此貨，希望你方儘早發運。

sentences.english: Those containers receive an inspection by local customs officials before departure.
sentences.chinese: 這些集裝箱在發運之前接受當地海關官員的檢查。

sentences.english: “The arrangements for that shipment will require detailed advance planning, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “安排那批貨物的發運事先需要詳細的計劃，”他說。

sentences.english: To make it easier for us to get the goods ready for shipment, we hope that partial shipment is allowed.
sentences.chinese: 爲了便於我方備貨裝船，希望允許分批發運。

sentences.english: Please send us the following items C. O. D.
sentences.chinese: 請按貨到付款條件發運下列商品。

sentences.english: She was busy with checking in luggage and buying tickets for us.
sentences.chinese: 她忙前忙後地幫我們發運行李，買好了車票。

sentences.english: The short-shipped goods will be forwarded together with your next order.
sentences.chinese: 短裝的貨物將與你方下一批訂貨一道發運。

sentences.english: How do you love the bads dispatched, by railway or by sea?
sentences.chinese: 你方將怎麼樣發運貨物，鐵路還得海運？

sentences.english: Review in detail the FPSC variable data.
sentences.chinese: 詳細檢查首次發運鑑定的計量型數據。

sentences.english: A firm in Naples has sent us a truck-load of prunes.
sentences.chinese: 那不勒斯一家公司發運給我們一卡車梅乾。

definition: security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
to be in overall charge/to oversee
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking

same as 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1], History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Ling county in Dezhou 德州[De2 zhou1], Shandong
Wu Guang (died 208 BC), Qin dynasty rebel, leader of the Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]
Zhang Xianzhong (1606-1647), leader of a late-Ming peasant revolt
